      73             :   struct ndarray;

      75             :   template <class T>
      76             :   struct type_helper;
      77             : 
      78             :   /* Helper for dimension-specific part of ndarray
      79             :    *
      80             :    * Instead of specializing the whole ndarray class, the dimension-specific
      81             :    *behavior are stored here.
      82             :    * There are two specialization for this type:
      83             :    * - a specialization depending on the dimensionality (==1 || > 1)
      84             :    * - a specialization depending on the constness.
      85             :    *
      86             :    * The raw ndarray<T,pS> specialization implies a *swallow copy* of the
      87             :    *ndarray, && thus a refcount increase.
      88             :    * It is meant to be used when indexing an rvalue, as in
      89             :    *``np.zeros(10)[i]``.
      90             :    *
      91             :    * The ndarray<T,pS> const& specialization implies a *reference copy*. It is
      92             :    *used when indexing a lvalue, as in ``a[i]``
      93             :    */
      94             : 
      95             :   template <class T, class pS>
      96             :   struct type_helper<ndarray<T, pS>> {
      97             :     static_assert(std::tuple_size<pS>::value != 1, "matching ok");
      98             :     using type = numpy_iexpr<ndarray<T, pS>>;
      99             :     using iterator = nditerator<ndarray<T, pS>>;
     100             :     using const_iterator = const_nditerator<ndarray<T, pS>>;
     101             : 
     102             :     type_helper() = delete; // Not intended to be instantiated
     103             : 
     104             :     static iterator make_iterator(ndarray<T, pS> &n, long i);
     105             :     static const_iterator make_iterator(ndarray<T, pS> const &n, long i);

     207             :   /* Multidimensional array of values
     208             :    *
     209             :    * An ndarray wraps a raw array pointers && manages multiple dimensions
     210             :    * casted overt the raw data.
     211             :    * The number of dimensions is fixed as well as the type of the underlying
     212             :    * data.
     213             :    * A shared pointer is used internally to mimic Python's behavior.
     214             :    *
     215             :    */
